page.title: 01Summary of Area
page.content: Our area follows the winding course of the{River Tamar}which is the natural border of the counties of Devon and Cornwall.The whole of our survey area has a history of mining mainly for copper and arsenic.On the Devon side there used to be the{Devon Consol {Mines}which finished mining for copper in 1902 but continued working for arsenic until 1940. This is now surrounded by a large area of forestry which is known as Tavistock Woodlands. On the Cornish side we have the {Clitters Mines}which helped in the development of the town of{Gunnislake. There is the village of{Chilsworthy and the four small hamlets of{ {Latchley, Townlake,Horsebridge}and{ {Cox Park}which are surrounded for the large part by agricultural land. The whole area is scenically beautiful.
